gurmukhi: rwjmyD krXo lgY AwrMB BUp Apwr ]BwNq BwNq smiRD jor suim`qR S`qR kumwr ]
transliteration: Raajmedh Daryo Lagad Aaranbh Bhoop Apaar|| Bhaant Bhaant Samridh Jor Soumittra Shattra Koumaar||
translation: Gathering his various friends, the king began the rajmedh Yajna;

gurmukhi: BwNq Anykn ky jury jn Awn kY iqh dys ]CIn CIn ley niRpwbr dyS idrb Aivnys ]122]
transliteration: Bhaant Anekan Ke Jure Jan Aan Kai Tih Des|| Chheen Chheen Lae Nripaabar Desh Dirab Avines||122||
translation: People of various kinds gathered there and the king also seized the wealth and property of he superb kings.122.

gurmukhi: dyK kY ieh BwNq srb su BUp sMpq nYx ]grb so BujdMf kY ieh BwNq bolw bYx ]
transliteration: Dekh Kai Eh Bhaant Sarab Su Bhoop Sanpat Nain|| Gadab So Bhujdannd Kai Eh Bhaant Bolaa Bain||
translation: Looking at his infinite wealth, feeling proud on the strength of his arms, spoke thus :

gurmukhi: BUp myD kro sBY qum Awj j`g ArMB ]sqju`g mwh BXo ijhI ibD kIn rwjY jMB ]123]
transliteration: Bhoop Maadh Daro Sabhai Toum Aaj Jagg Aranbh|| Satjougg Maah Bhayo Jihibidh Keen Raajai Janbh||123||
translation: “O Brahmins ! now perform such Bhoopmedh Yajna, which was performed by Jambhasura in Satyuga.”123.

gurmukhi: l`C jau niRp mwrIXjY qb hoq hY niRp myD ]eyk eyk Anyk sMpq dIjIXY BivKyD ]
transliteration: Lachchh Jau Nrip Maariyai Tab Hot Nrip Medh|| Ek Ek Anek Sanpat Deejeeyai Bhavikhedh||
translation: “If one lakh are killed, then the Rajmedh Yajna can be performed and to each Brahmin innumerable wealth,

gurmukhi: l`C l`C qrMg eykih dIjIAY Aibcwr ]j`g pUrx hoqu hY sun rwj rwjvqwr ]124]
transliteration: Lachchh Lachchh Taran Ekah(i) Deejeeai Abichaar|| Jagg Pooran Hot(u) Hai Soun Raaj Raajavtaar||124||
translation: And one lakh horses are to be given immediately; in this way, O king ! the Yajna can be completed.124.

gurmukhi: BwNq BwNq sumiRD sMpq dIjIXY iek bwr ]l`C hsq qurMg dÍY l`C suvrn Bwr Apwr ]
transliteration: Bhaant Bhaant Soumridh Sanpat Deejeeyai Ik Baar|| Lachchh Hasat Turan Dvai Lachhsuvarn Bhaar Apaar||
translation: “Many types of gifts of wealth and property and one lakh elephants and two lakh horses and one lakh gold coins are to be given to each of the Brahmin :

gurmukhi: kot kot idjyk eykih dIjIXY AiblMb ]j`g pUrx hoie qau sun rwj rwj AsMB ]125]
transliteration: Kot Kot Kijek Ekah(i) Deejeeuai Abilanb|| Jagg Pooran Hoe Tau Soun Raaj Raaj Asanbh||125||
translation: “O king ! by donating these to crores of Brahmins, this impossible Yajna can be completed.125.

gurmukhi: suvrn kI n ieqI kmI jau tUt hY bhu brK ]hsq kI n kmI muJY hX swr lIjY prK ]
transliteration: Suvarankina Itikamijau Toot Hai Bahu Brakh|| Hasat Kina Kamimujhai Haya Saar Leejai Parakh||
translation: “There is no shortage of gold and inspite of donating it for many years, it will not go out of stock; took at the house of elephants and the stable of horses, there is no shortage of them;

gurmukhi: Aaur jau Dn cwhIXY so lIjIXY Aibcwr ]ic`q mY n kCU kro sun mMqR imqR Avqwr ]126]
transliteration: Aur Jau Dhan Haaheeyai So Leejeeyai Abichaar|| Chitt Main A Kachhodh Daro Soun Mantra Mitra Avtaar||126||
translation: “O minister-friend ! do not have any doubt in your mind and whatever wealth is wanted, take it immediately.”126.

gurmukhi: iXau jbY niRp aucrXo qb mMqR br sun bYn ]hwQ jor slwm kY niRp mIc kY jug nYn ]
transliteration: Yio Jabai Nrip Oucdaryo Tab Mantra Bar Soun Bain|| Haath Jor Salaam Kai Nrip Meech Kai Joug Nain||
translation: When the king said like this, then the minister closed his eyes and bowed before the king with folded hands;
